[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Why is your face so red and splotchy, Classmates B? Did you get sunburned?
No, I didn't get sunburned. I'm just feeling a bit embarrassed.
Embarrassed? Why?
It's nothing, really. Just something embarrassing happened to me earlier.
Come on, tell me! I won't judge you, I promise.
Well, I accidentally spilled my lunch all over myself in front of some people.
(laughs) That's it? That's why you're embarrassed? I thought it was something serious.
(sighs) Yeah, it's silly. But still embarrassing.
Don't worry about it. It happens to everyone. Remember the time I tripped and fell in front of the whole class during our presentation?

[MEMORY]
